channel.title: Issues Involving Server Online Status via VPS
channel.description:
Currently I have a VPS with my server running on it, I am able to connect to the exact ip address, but I have a no-ip setup which is not working properly. Is there a specific way to portforward the vps for no-ip?
I am able to connect to the VPS's ip address through my client (the exact ip) not the no-ip (address)
Can someone please help?

item.title: Issues Involving Server Online Status via VPS
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:4, topic:547100”][quote author=speady888888 link=topic=665999.msg4452902#msg4452902 date=1412771661]
The DUC is running and i verified the validation of the no-ip. It is on the VPS side
[/quote]
if you’re on windows:
Did you allow TCP & UDP with the port 43594 in your firewall?
If you did, contact the company and tell them what issue you have.[/quote]
Regardless, contact them. They have the tools (and should have the knowledge) to port forward any port on their systems.
Like I said, tell them you need help opening port 43594. They can/will do the rest. OR they’ll tell you how

Read full topic
item.source: Issues Involving Server Online Status via VPS

item.title: Issues Involving Server Online Status via VPS
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

speady888888:

The DUC is running and i verified the validation of the no-ip. It is on the VPS side

if you’re on windows:
Did you allow TCP & UDP with the port 43594 in your firewall?
If you did, contact the company and tell them what issue you have.

Read full topic

item.title: Issues Involving Server Online Status via VPS
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure you have the No-IP DUC running on the VPS…
Also 9/10 vps related questions are to be directed at your vps host… As they’re kinda in charge of that shit.

Read full topic
